meanings.definition: Combining in such a way as to enhance or emphasize the qualities of each other.
meanings.sent1: The red and green colors were complementary and made the painting vibrant.
meanings.sent2: The chef used complementary spices to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The clown's outfit was so colorful and complementary that it made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Their personalities were complementary like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The music and lyrics were so complementary that it created a beautiful harmony.

meanings.sent1: The final piece of the puzzle was complementary and completed the picture.
meanings.sent2: The missing ingredient was complementary and made the recipe whole.
meanings.sent3: The last chapter of the book was so complementary that it tied up all loose ends.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a missing piece, complementary and making his day whole.
meanings.sent5: The sunset was complementary, completing the day with its beauty.

meanings.definition: Something that completes or brings to perfection.
meanings.sent1: In their relationship, she was the complementary that brought out the best in him.
meanings.sent2: The final touch on the painting was the perfect complementary to make it a masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The secret ingredient in the recipe turned out to be the missing complementary for perfection.
meanings.sent4: His supportive nature was the complementary that completed her sense of fulfillment.
meanings.sent5: The diamond necklace was the ideal complementary to her elegant dress.
